bccList.description: The Bcc recipients. Not populated for news/nntp messages.

ccList.description: The Cc recipients. Not populated for news/nntp messages.

folder.description: The <permission>accountsRead</permission> permission is required for this property to be included.

headerMessageId.description: The message-id header of the message.

recipients.description: The To recipients. Not populated for news/nntp messages.

size.description: The total size of the message in bytes.

types.description: Represents an email message "part", which could be the whole message

headers.description: An object of part headers, with the header name as key, and an array of header values as value

name.description: Name of the part, if it is a file

key.description: Distinct tag identifier â€“ use this string when referring to a tag

types.description: Used for filtering messages by tag in various methods. Note that functions using this type may have a partial implementation.

tags.description: Object keys are tags to filter on, values are true if the message must have the tag, or false if it must not have the tag. For a list of available tags, call the :ref:`messages.listTags` method.

mode.description: Whether all of the tag filters must apply, or any of them.

types.description: Represents an attachment in a message.

contentType.description: The content type of the attachment.

name.description: The name, as displayed to the user, of this attachment. This is usually but not always the filename of the attached file.

partName.description: Identifies the MIME part of the message associated with this attachment.

size.description: The size in bytes of this attachment.

events.name: onNewMailReceived
events.description: Fired when a new message is received, and has been through junk classification and message filters.

functions.name: list
functions.description: Gets all messages in a folder.

functions.name: continueList
functions.description: Returns the next chunk of messages in a list. See :doc:`how-to/messageLists` for more information.

functions.name: getFull
functions.description: Returns a specified message, including all headers and MIME parts.

functions.name: getRaw
functions.description: Returns the unmodified source of a message as a `binary string <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMString/Binary>`__.

functions.name: listAttachments
functions.description: Lists all of the attachments of a message.

functions.name: getAttachmentFile
functions.description: Gets the content of an attachment as a DOM File object.

functions.name: query
functions.description: Gets all messages that have the specified properties, or all messages if no properties are specified.

author.description: Returns only messages with this value matching the author. The search value is a single email address, a name or a combination (e.g.: ``Name <user@domain.org>``). The address part of the search value (if provided) must match the author's address completely. The name part of the search value (if provided) must match the author's name partially. All matches are done case-insensitive.

body.description: Returns only messages with this value in the body of the mail.

flagged.description: Returns only flagged (or unflagged if false) messages.

folder.description: Returns only messages from the specified folder. The <permission>accountsRead</permission> permission is required.

fromDate.description: Returns only messages with a date after this value.

fromMe.description: Returns only messages with the author's address matching any configured identity.

fullText.description: Returns only messages with this value somewhere in the mail (subject, body or author).

headerMessageId.description: Returns only messages with a Message-ID header matching this value.

includeSubFolders.description: Search the folder specified by ``queryInfo.folder`` recursively.

recipients.description: Returns only messages whose recipients match all specified addresses. The search value is a semicolon separated list of email addresses, names or combinations (e.g.: ``Name <user@domain.org>``). For a match, all specified addresses must equal a recipient's address completely and all specified names must match a recipient's name partially. All matches are done case-insensitive.

subject.description: Returns only messages with this value matching the subject.

tags.description: Returns only messages with the specified tags. For a list of available tags, call the :ref:`messages.listTags` method.

toDate.description: Returns only messages with a date before this value.

toMe.description: Returns only messages with at least one recipient address matching any configured identity.

unread.description: Returns only unread (or read if false) messages.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Marks or unmarks a message as read, flagged, or tagged.

read.description: Marks the message as read or unread.

junk.description: Marks the message as junk or not junk.

flagged.description: Marks the message as flagged or unflagged.

tags.description: Sets the tags on the message. For a list of available tags, call the listTags method.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves messages to a specified folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to move.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The folder to move the messages to.

functions.name: copy
functions.description: Copies messages to a specified folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to copy.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The folder to copy the messages to.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Deletes messages, or moves them to the trash folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to delete.

parameters.name: skipTrash
parameters.description: If true, the message will be permanently deleted without warning the user. If false or not specified, it will be moved to the trash folder.

functions.name: archive
functions.description: Archives messages using the current settings.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to archive.

functions.name: listTags
functions.description: Returns a list of tags that can be set on messages, and their human-friendly name, colour, and sort order.
